SAFETY

Like all of models in our XD® line, the XD-S™ has all of the safety features to ensure your safety and the safety of those around you while handling the pistol.

Ultra Safety Assurance (USA)
Trigger System™
The USA Trigger System™ guards against accidental discharge, from dropping or bumping it, by locking the trigger in place until direct rearward pressure is applied.

Loaded Chamber Indicator
The Loaded Chamber Indicator allows the shooter to verify without a doubt, visually or by touch, that there is a round in the chamber.

Grip Safety
All XD®, XD(M)® and XD-S™ models allows firing only when the shooter has a firm grip on the pistol.

Fail-Safe Disassembly
The XD-S™ disassembles just like the XD®, however, with the XD-S™, the disassembly lever cannot be manipulated with a magazine in the pistol. Additionally, when the disassembly lever is up, a magazine cannot be inserted into the pistol.

Secure Grip Texture
The “all-terrain” look of the XD(M)® has proven to work so well that the texture has been enhanced for the XD-S™ with an even more pronounced texture to ensure your grip is always secure.

Melonite® Finish and Carrying Case
To preserve the safety and quality of your pistol, we’ve added a Melonite® finish on all XD® models for a deep penetrating finish that protects against corrosion. Also, our rugged case is as durable as the XD-S™ trademark it carries.

title: For Sale:  Mosin Nagant Collection
postcontent:
It is time to part ways with my Mosin Nagant "collection". I have other things going on that I need to focus on, although I am really going to hate to see them go. Here is a list of everything included in this package. I am not looking to separate at this time.

- (3) Mosin Nagant rifles. 1 - Tula (Soviet Union) M91/30 1939, 1 - Izhevsk (Soviet Union) M91/30 1943, and 1 - Romania M44 1955. 
- Approx. 1,300 rounds of 7.62x54r ammo. Most are sealed and a majority is the silver tipped armor piercing. 
- 3 x Bayonets (2 are removable, and the other is attached to the M44)
- 2 x Original ammo carrying pouches
- 1 x Oil can
- 1 x Tool kit
- 1 x bore snake cleaning tool
- 1 x Original M91/30 stock
- 3 x Original cleaning rods

All 3 rifles have been professionally inspected (bores, chambers, rifling, etc.), and all passed. Both the M44 and the 1939 M91/30 are in original condition. 

The 1943 M91/30 has had a modern stock, scope mount, scope, and muzzle break all professionally installed by a gun smith. The bolt on the rifle with the upgrades has also been "bent" to allow it to work with the scope installed. This was also done by a professional gun smith. The original stock is included. The scope that was added is a Bushnell Banner Dusk & Dawn 6-24x40mm Mil-Dot (paid $200 for it). I have taken this rifle to hunt Hogs down south, and it is incredibly accurate and powerful (twice I took down hogs weighing in excess of 500 lbs with one shot at over 100 yards).

Everything (including the rifles) are in excellent condition given there age. Each rifle fires exactly as it should with no issues that I am aware of. 

Price for the entire package is $800. I feel this is an extremely fair price considering I have well over $1000 in this package, not including most of the accessories. Must be 18 to purchase with a valid ID. Will not ship, FTF only. I am a valid CHL/CCW holder and would like to do business with a CHL/CCW holder as well, but not required. Again, I will not separate anything at this time, please do not ask. Thanks for looking. 

NOTE: 2 of the 3 rifles have matching serial #'s on the bolt, barrel, and bottom of the magazine. The one that doesn't is the M44.

title: For Sale:  Mosin Nagant Collection
postcontent:
It is time to part ways with my Mosin Nagant "collection". I have other things going on that I need to focus on, although I am really going to hate to see them go. Here is a list of everything included in this package. I am not looking to separate at this time.

- (3) Mosin Nagant rifles. 1 - Tula (Soviet Union) M91/30 1939, 1 - Izhevsk (Soviet Union) M91/30 1943, and 1 - Romania M44 1955. 
- Approx. 1,300 rounds of 7.62x54r ammo. Most are sealed and a majority is the silver tipped armor piercing. 
- 3 x Bayonets (2 are removable, and the other is attached to the M44)
- 2 x Original ammo carrying pouches
- 1 x Oil can
- 1 x Tool kit
- 1 x bore snake cleaning tool
- 1 x Original M91/30 stock
- 3 x Original cleaning rods

All 3 rifles have been professionally inspected (bores, chambers, rifling, etc.), and all passed. Both the M44 and the 1939 M91/30 are in original condition. 

The 1943 M91/30 has had a modern stock, scope mount, scope, and muzzle break all professionally installed by a gun smith. The bolt on the rifle with the upgrades has also been "bent" to allow it to work with the scope installed. This was also done by a professional gun smith. The original stock is included. The scope that was added is a Bushnell Banner Dusk & Dawn 6-24x40mm Mil-Dot (paid $200 for it). I have taken this rifle to hunt Hogs down south, and it is incredibly accurate and powerful (twice I took down hogs weighing in excess of 500 lbs with one shot at over 100 yards).

Everything (including the rifles) are in excellent condition given there age. Each rifle fires exactly as it should with no issues that I am aware of. 

Price for the entire package is $800. I feel this is an extremely fair price considering I have well over $1000 in this package, not including most of the accessories. Must be 18 to purchase with a valid ID. Will not ship, FTF only. I am a valid CHL/CCW holder and would like to do business with a CHL/CCW holder as well, but not required. Again, I will not separate anything at this time, please do not ask. Thanks for looking. 

NOTE: 2 of the 3 rifles have matching serial #'s on the bolt, barrel, and bottom of the magazine. The one that doesn't is the M44.

title: For Sale:  1941 Beretta M1934 With Ammunition [380 ACP]
postcontent:
Up for sale is my Italian Model 1934, sold under contract in 1941 to the Romanian army. This pistol has no import marks and the barrel matches, so it is likely a captured pistol and was brought back to the U.S. at the end of the war.

The markings "CAL.9 SCURT" is Romanian for "9mm short" which is the 380 ACP here in the U.S. The (CM) stamp is the Romanian acceptance stamp and the (EZ) is an inspector's mark. This contract was originally for 60,000 pistols but the Italians did not deliver more than about 40,000 pistols. This pistol was likely delivered in Feb. 1941.

Minor holster rash and patina. Comes with a 1 mag, a polyester holster, the original grips as well as the ones shown, and 2 50 round boxes of PMC Bronze.

Asking $300.
thanks,
Steven

title: For Sale:  Elcan DigitalHunter Day/Night Digital Riflescope w/Video
postcontent: Brand New-Never been mounted.  Great for recording first-timers, students and even professionals the Elcan DigitalHunter Parallax Free Digital Riflescope ELDHDN lets you record your shots so you can view them later. This Digital Rifle Scope from Elcan  has a Daylight Mode that provides excellent imagery for targeting during the day while the Lowlight Mode gives stunning low light level performance.  This Elcan Riflescope is a lower-cost, good-resolution alternative to image intensifier or infrared rifles scopes. And since the Elcan DigitalHunter DayNight is a digital riflescope, it provides electronic ballistic compensation, automatic video and still image capture and replay, field selectable reticles, and customizable reticles. The Elcan Digital-Hunter Day - Night Digital Riflescope w/ Video Capture is not plagued with common telescope issues such as parallax, magnification change-induced bore sight shifts and exit pupil diameter reduction, and limited eye relief. Electronic ballistic compensation enables the shooter to "hold where you want to hit"! Elcan DigitalHunter Digital Rifle Scope is a range compensating riflescope, removing one contributor (holdover estimate) from the shooting equation. The four field selectable reticles, when coupled with the four ballistic data tables, enable the scope to function as four different rifle scopes. The Elcan DigitalHunter Digital Riflescope can be setup for a center fire rifle, a shotgun (great for turkey), a crossbow and a muzzleloader. Since the reticles are graphic images they can be any color, shape or size that can be drawn by the user via bitmap generating software...circles, lines, squares. Parallax is avoided since they aren't physical features of an image plane.  Check out the Youtube Video http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CfRWsd2czdU

title: For Sale:  Firearms conceal and carry training
postcontent: Firearms conceal and carry class that will allow you to carry a conceal firearm in the following states: IL, IN, AL, AK, AZ, AR, ID, IA, KS, KY, MI, MS, MO, NC, OK, SD, TN, UT, AND VT. This class is offered by a police officer in Illinois with 19 years in law enforcement and is a federal and state certified firearms instructor. The instructor also was recruited by the Department of Defense in 2004 to go to Baghdad, Iraq to help open and operate the largest police academy in the word where he was the head of the handgun training for the entire academy. It is no secret that this is troubling times for everyone. There are dangers faced everyday no matter what your occupation is or if you just travel across the country, it is your constitutional right to possess a firearm. This class is available to anyone in any state in America as long as you are a legal gun owner. The cost of the class is $150.00 and then there is a fee to pay to the state of Illinois and the conceal license is good for 5 years. This license is good in all the states mentioned including Illinois. At this time Illinois does not recognize any other states conceal license so unless you have this class you CANNOT conceal and carry a gun in Illinois. Chief Darnell is the head instructor and would be willing to travel to your location to do the training if there were enough students or if a group wanted to take the class without traveling here. Signing up couldn’t be easier, just message Chief Billy Darnell at REDACTED or go to his Facebook page and leave a message. Anyone wishing to come to this class has several options for lodging. There are hotels within 15 minutes of the class along with a very nice camp ground with water and electric for campers one minute from our class room with a beautiful river with boat access, fishing and ATV trails. Students who camp get a discount on nightly rates at our camp ground. The cost to camp is $15.00 a night if you are signed up as a student in this class no matter how many people you have in your party or if you are in a tent or a R.V. or camper. Come enjoy a weekend of training during the day, then in the evening kick back and relax on the Wabash river fishing or take off on a night ride on your ATV on the trails. It would be a great way to spend quality time with loved ones or friends and get the training you need at the same time at the lowest price possible.

title: For Sale:  Beretta Super Sport .22 Cal. Semi-Auto Rifle / PRICE REDUCED
location: South East Virginnia, Virginia, United States
postcontent:
NOTE: it is the buyers responsibility to confirm that this firearm is legal to own in your state and/or locality.

Offered for your consideration is one (1) Beretta Super Sport .22 caliber semi-automatic rifle. This Beretta has never been officially imported into the United States. The very few examples of this rifle found here in the USA have either been brought back by returning military personal who were deployed in Europe, or by people who were returning to, or entering into, the USA from a European country.

Beretta manufactured this rifle model from the mid 1950’s until the mid / late 1960’s. Beretta’s XX proof mark, located on the barrel where it joins the receiver, indicates that this particular rifle was manufactured in 1964.

There were two other .22 caliber rifles manufactured by Beretta during this time. They were the Olympia, and the Sport Models. The Super Sport Model was designed for special heavy service in target shooting having a much more robust walnut stock with a large checkered fore end, heavy pistol grip, specially shaped cheek rest, and longer barrel than that of the Sport Model. This rifle is in outstanding condition only showing some handling marks on the stock. I would rate the metal finish at 95+%. This is truly a rare, and difficult to find, rifle that would enhance any firearm collection, and a great one to shoot and enjoy.

Additional pictures upon request.

title: For Sale:  First Strike Silver Eagles No where close to $500 value
postcontent:
First, I am a collector.  Second don't loose your valuable firearm.  I'm not sure if the seller of the first strike silver eagles is aware of true price, but if they are they are very dishonest.

These coins are sold for inflated prices on TV and eBay, but still not $100 a piece.  Being first strike makes them no more valuable than other silver eagles.  From reputable companies silver angles sell for around $25 a piece right now and you can have them graded for less than $10 each.  Grading of eagles is useless because if times get hard they are still only worth their silver value.

Today's silver closed at $20.38/ounce and this seller is asking $100/ounce do the math.  Each of these coins is 1 ounce.

title: For Sale:  Ruger 10/22 Tri Mag + Free G2 PMAG
postcontent:
If you're familiar with the Ruger 10/22, it tends to eat ammo pretty quickly. This sale is for (3) 10 round Ruger magazines - attached together into the "Tri-Mag" configuration. 

This results in 30 total rounds. 

This has been used twice. As I mentioned before, I've noticed the 10/22 needs to be fed more ammo, so I'm switching up to the BX-25's, but don't want these to just sit in a corner, when they can be doing someone some good. 

In addition, I just purchased a .223 and I'm not a big Magpul fanboy. WIth the gun, came a free G2 PMAG. I'm not going to use it (going to use Troy Battlemags instead). I was going to just throw it out, but thought that I'd include it with this auction for $0, just in the off chance the successful bidder for the Ruger mags also happens to have a black gun. If you don't - you can throw it out if you'd like. You're not out anything, I'm not charging you for it. 

Speaking of not charging, I'm going to ship this for free as well! (USPS flat rate). 

Pretty good deal, I think. 

Send me an email about payment. Cash, money order, or check accepted for payment. If you have any other quick, discreet payment ideas, email me. 

Thanks!
